Split a string into array by a character delimiter [Java]

10 Mar 2012

JavaME actually as there could be a string method to do this in Java (which I doubt though). Anyways, the objective is to split a string into array by a character delimiter, like the explode function in php.

Here:

 1 private String[] charSplit(char delimiter, String subject)
 2 {
 3     Vector chunkStore = new Vector();
 4     String chunk = "";
 5     char [] subjectChars = subject.toCharArray();
 6 
 7     for(int i=0;i<subjectChars.length;i++)
 8     {
 9         if (subjectChars[i] == delimiter)
10         {
11             chunkStore.addElement(chunk);
12             chunk = "";
13         }
14         else
15             chunk += subjectChars[i];
16     }
17     chunkStore.addElement(chunk);
18     
19     String [] pieces = new String[chunkStore.size()];
20     chunkStore.copyInto(pieces);
21 
22     return pieces;
23 }

Example

Working on the Prowork mobile app, I have to convert a date field (from the due date for a new task) to mysql format for the (unofficial) api. Unfortunately the string representation of date from the datefield in J2ME is dow mon dd hh:mm:ss zzz yyyy and to convert this mysql's yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss I need to split this string by space and join together the pieces in the wanted order.

 1 // Return date in mysql format: yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss
 2 private String formatDate(Date date)
 3 {
 4     // Convert the date to string:
 5     // i.e dow mon dd hh:mm:ss zzz yyyy
 6     String dateString = date.toString();
 7     // Split by space
 8     String [] dateObjects = charSplit(' ', dateString);
 9     // so we have [0] = dow, [1] = mon, [2] = dd, [3] hh:mm:ss, etc
10 
11     // Get month index from month (dateObjects[1])
12     // --> We need to convert the returned mnt from say Dec to 12
13     // There are/should be better ways to do this
14     String [] months = {"Jan","Feb","Mar","Apr","May","Jun","Jul","Aug","Sep","Oct","Nov","Dec"};
15     int monthIndex = 0;
16     for(int i=0;i<months.length;i++)
17     {
18         if (dateObjects[1].equalsIgnoreCase(months[i]))
19         {
20             monthIndex = i+1;
21             break;
22         }
23     }
24     // Put the preceeding 0 (for 01 to 09) if need be 
25     String month = monthIndex > 9 ? ""+monthIndex : "0"+monthIndex;
26     
27     String formattedDate = dateObjects[5]+"-"+month+"-"+dateObjects[2]+" "+dateObjects[3];
28     //System.out.println(formattedDate);
29     return formattedDate;
30 }
